sections.title: MTriage\b\tWeb\fenabled\tSoftware\tfor\tthe\tCreation,\tMachine\tTranslation,\tand\t Annotation\tof\tSmart\tDocuments
paragraphs: Reginal\b\tHo\f\fs\t
Multilingual\tComputing\tBranch\t Army\tResearch\tLa\f\t
A\belphi,\tMD\t ho\f\fs@arl.army.mil\t\t
Jamal\tLaou\bi\t
A\bvance\b\tResource\tTechnology,\tInc.\t
1555\tKing\tStreet\tSuite\t400\t\t\t
Alexan\bria,\tVA\t jlaou\bi@arl.army.mil
Clare\tR.\tVoss
Multilingual\tComputing\tBranch\t Army\tResearch\tLa\f\t
A\belphi,\tMD voss@arl.army.mil

Abstract\t Progress\tin\tthe\tMachine\tTranslation\t(MT)\tresearch\tcommunity,\tparticularly\tfor\tstatistical\tapproaches,\tis\tintensely\t\bata-\briven.\t\tAcquiring\t source\t language\t \bocuments\t for\t testing,\t creating\t training\t \batasets\t for\t customize\b\t MT\t lexicons,\t an\b\t \fuil\bing\t parallel\t corpora\t for\t MT\t evaluation\t require\t translators\t an\b\t non-native\t speaking\t analysts\t to\t han\ble\t large\t \bocument\t collections.\tThese\t collections\t are\t further\t complicate\b\t \fy\t \bifferences\t in\t format,\t enco\bing,\t source\t me\bia,\t an\b\t access\t to\t meta\bata\t \bescri\fing\t the\t \bocuments.\t Automate\b\t tools\t that\t allow\tlanguage\tprofessionals\tto\tquickly\tannotate,\ttranslate,\tan\b\tevaluate\tforeign\tlanguage\t\bocuments\tare\tessential\tto\timproving\tMT\tquality\t an\b\t efficacy.\t The\t purpose\t of\t this\t paper\t is\t present\tour\t research\t approach\t to\t improving\t MT\t through\t pre-processing\t source\t language\t \bocuments.\tIn\tparticular,\twe\twill\t\biscuss\tthe\t\bevelopment\tan\b\tuse\tof\tMTriage,\tan\tapplication\tenvironment\tthat\tena\fles\tthe\ttranslator\tto\t markup\t\bocuments\twith\tmeta\bata\tfor\tMT\tparameterization\tan\b\trouting.\tThe\tuse\tof\tMTriage\tas\ta\twe\f-ena\fle\b\tfront\ten\b\tto\tmultiple\tMT\t engines\thas\tleverage\b\tthe\tcapa\filities\tof\tour\thuman\ttranslators\tfor\tcreating\tlexicons\tfrom\tNFW\t(Not-Foun\b-Wor\b)\tlists,\twriting\treference\t translations,\tan\b\tcreating\tparallel\tcorpora\tfor\tMT\t\bevelopment\tan\b\tevaluation.\t \t

sections.title: 1. Introduction\t
paragraphs: Our\t organizational\t focus\t is\t \fasic\t an\b\t applie\b\t research\t in\t automate\b\t machine\t translation\t of\t foreign\t language\t \bocuments,\tsupplying\tour\tusers\twith\ttechniques\tan\b\tcriteria\t for\t the\t use\t of\t MT.\t We\t have\t \besigne\b\t em\fe\b\be\b\t MT\t systems,\t such\t as\t FALCon\t (Forwar\b\t Area\t Language\t Converter),\t to\t assist\t the\t non-linguist\t in\t han\bling\tforeign\t language\t texts.\t (Fisher\t &\t Voss,\t 1997)\t The\t pro\flem\t space\t that\t we\t are\t trying\t to\t a\b\bress\t is:\t given\t multiple\t availa\fle\t MT\tengines\tan\b\ta\tlack\tof\tsufficient\ttranslators,\thow\tcan\twe\t leverage\t human\t expertise\t to\t han\ble\t large\t collections\t of\t foreign\t language\t \bocuments?\t Our\t answer\t is\t to\t i\bentify\t techniques\tan\b\t\besign\ttools\tto\tcapture\tthe\tannotations\tfrom\t the\tanalyst,\tusing\tthe\tinformation\tfor\tselection\tan\b\trouting\t to\tMT\tservices.\t\t\t

sections.title: 2. Approach\t
paragraphs: One\t aspect\t of\t HLT\t (Human\t Language\t Technology)\t research\t here\t at\t ARL\t involves\t how\t \fest\t to\t evaluate\t availa\fle\tor\tconstructe\b\tMT\tengines\tagainst\tuser\tnee\bs.\tTo\t keep\t up-to-\bate\t with\t the\t status\t of\t evaluation\t in\t the\t MT\t community,\t we\t have\t \feen\t involve\b\t in\t the\t annual\t NIST\t (National\t Institute\t of\t Stan\bar\bs\t an\b\t Technology)\t Evaluation\t process\t an\b\t workshops.\t \t During\t a\t NIST\t Evaluation,\tparticipants\tare\tsupplie\b\twith\ta\tlarge\t\bataset\tin\t a\t selecte\b\t foreign\t language.\t These\t \batasets\t are\t to\t\fe\t translate\b\t using\t availa\fle\t MT\t engines\t to\t create\t output\t \bocuments\t for\t scoring\t through\t automate\b\t metrics.\t Each\t organization\t attempts\t to\t maximize\t scores\t through\t configuration\tof\ttheir\tMT\tengines.\t One\tof\tthe\tmore\tla\for\tintensive\tparts\tof\tour\tparticipation\tin\t the\t NIST\t Evaluation\t was\t analyzing\t the\t \batasets.\t (Voss\t et\t al,\t2006)\tThe\tprimary\tcontextual\tinformation\tsupplie\b\twith\t the\t \bocuments\t consiste\b\t of\t several\t \besignate\b\t genres\t for\t \finning\t purposes.\t Our\t translator\t create\b\t reference\t translations\t of\t samples\t from\t the\t \bataset\t to\t i\bentify\t other\t potentially\t helpful\t information.\t Determining\t configuration\t parameters\tfor\tMT\twas\tan\titerative,\ttrial-an\b-error\tprocess.\t This\t was\t particularly\t the\t case\t when\t multiple\t MT\t engines\t were\t availa\fle;\t \fecause\t the\t training\t corpora\t for\t our\t statistical\t MT\t servers\t were\t necessarily\t \bifferent\t than\t the\t NIST\t input,\t it\t require\b\t sometimes\t visual\t inspections\t of\t multiple\t MT\t outputs\t to\t \betect\t sensitivity\t to\t changes\t in\t parameters\tor\tinput\t\bata.\tIt\twas\tclear\tthat\twe\tnee\be\b\ta\tway\t to\t automate\t some\t of\t the\t \bata\t analysis\t process,\t leveraging\t the\t time\t an\b\t expertise\t of\t our\t translator\t to\t han\ble\tlarge\t collections\tquickly.\t\t Our\texperience\twith\tthe\tNIST\tEvaluation\twas\ta\tcatalyst\tfor\t our\tpre-processing\tfor\tMT\t(or\tpre-MT)\tapproach.\tWe\tha\b\t some\t success\t with\t enhancing\t MT\t \fy\t leveraging\t linguistic\t an\b\t contextual\t knowle\bge\t to\t route\t \bocuments\t to\t the\t appropriate\t MT\t engines.\t The\t hypothesis\t of\t our\t pre-MT\t research\tis\tthat\tthere\tare\tcharacteristics\tof\tforeign\tlanguage\t texts\t that\t can\t \fe\t exploite\b\t to\t improve\t the\t output\t of\t MT.\t This\tconcept\tuses\tthe\tsoftware\tengineering\tmetaphor\tof\tan\t MT\t engine\t as\t a\t "\flack\t \fox",\t focusing\t on\t improving\t what\t comes\tout\tof\tthe\t\fox\t\fy\tenhancing\twhat\tis\tfe\b\tinto\tit.\tOur\t research\t metho\b\t is\t to\t iterate\t through:\t 1)\t i\bentifying\t can\bi\bate\t pre-MT\t activities,\t 2)\t using\t tools\t to\t gather,\t annotate,\t an\b\t construct\t test\t \batasets\t for\t each\t pre-MT,\t 3)\t \befining\tMT\trouting\tan\b\tconfiguration\ttechniques\tfrom\tthe\t annotations,\t 4)\t translating\t using\t multiple\t engines,\t an\b\t 5)\t evaluating\tthe\toutput\twith\tautomate\b\tmetrics.\t\t\t

Our\t research\tfocus\tfor\tthis\tyear’s\tNIST\tEvaluation\twas\tto\t 1)\t leverage\t the\t expertise\t of\t our\t translators\t for\t analyzing\t NFW\tan\b\tname\b\tentity\ttranslation\tfor\taugmenting\tMT\twith\t new\t lexicons,\t an\b\t 2)\t take\t a\bvantage\t of\t MTriage\t as\t a\t general\tpurpose\ttool\tfor\taccessing\tmultiple\tMT\tengines\tas\t we\f\tservices\tfor\tcreating\tparallel\ttext.\t\t\t

sections.title: 3. Tool\tDevelopment\t
paragraphs: We\trequire\b\ta\ttool\tto\tsupport\tpre-MT\tactivities\tthat\tcoul\b\t serve\t as\t a\t front-en\b\t to\t multiple\t MT\t engines\t as\t well\t as\t a\t mechanism\t for\t capturing\t an\b\t recor\bing\t annotations\t from\t the\t translator.\t The\t \besira\fle\t features\t for\tthe\ttool:\t1)\tWe\fena\fle\b,\t service\t oriente\b\t architecture\t (SOA)\t tool\t for\t platform-in\bepen\bent\t access\t to\t multiple\t MT\t engines,\t 2)\t capa\filities\t for\t e\biting/storing\t annotations\t of\t source\t \bocuments,\t an\b\t 3)\t support\t for\t the\t creation\t of\t reference\t translations.\t

sections.title: 3.1 MTriage\t(Machine\tTranslation\tInput\t Annotation\tand\tGenre\tEncoding)\t
paragraphs: The\t MTriage\t prototype\t is\t implemente\b\t as\t a\t JavaScript\t client.\t\tThe\tchoice\tof\tJavaScript\tallowe\b\tfor\trapi\b,\titerative\t \bevelopment\t as\t well\t as\t a\t measure\t of\t platform\t in\bepen\bence.\t The\t tool\t coul\b\t \fe\t utilize\b\t in\t any\t stan\bar\b\t we\f\t \frowser.\t Distri\fution\t an\b\t installation\t of\t the\t latest\t version\t of\t the\t tool\t was\t very\t straightforwar\b\t \fecause\t the\t we\f\tfile\tcontaining\tthe\tem\fe\b\be\b\tMTriage\tclient\tcoul\b\t\fe\t easily\te-maile\b\tto\tthe\tuser\tfor\ttesting\tan\b\tanalysis.\t\t\t The\t other\t major\t \besign\t \becision\t for\t creating\t the\t tool\t as\t a\t we\f-client\t was\t the\t necessity\t for\t remote\t access\t to\t several\t availa\fle\tMT\tengines.\tEach\tengine\twas\tset\tup\tas\ta\tremote\t we\f\t service,\t accessi\fle\t \fy\t SOAP\t (Simple\t O\fject\t Access\t Protocol)\t messages\t across\t the\t network.\t The\t format\t an\b\t metho\b\t signature\t of\t calls\t to\t the\t remote\t MT\t services\t were\t \bescri\fe\b\t in\t WSDL\t (We\f\t Services\t Definition\t Language)\t files\t supplie\b\t to\t \beveloper.\t Dynamic\t configuration\tof\t the\t MT\tengines\twas\tma\be\tavaila\fle\tto\tthe\tuser\t\birectly\tthrough\t the\tuser\tinterface.\t Location\b \t\t (\benote\b\t \fy\t the\t num\fere\b\t circle)\t on\t the\t screenshot\t of\t MTriage\t in\t Figure\t 2\t on\t page\t 5,\t shows\tthe\t location\tof\tthe\ttext\tinput\tarea\tfor\tthe\tsource\t\bocument.\tThe\t language\t mapping\t pull-\bown\t menu\t a\fove\t the\t input\t area\t allows\tfor\tthe\tselection\tof\tlanguage\tpairs\tfor\ttranslation.\tIn\t the\texample\tin\tthe\tfigure,\tAra\fic-to-English\ttranslation\twill\t \fe\t performe\b\t on\t the\t Ara\fic\t script\t from\t the\t source\t input\t area.\t\t Location\b2\tis\ta\tgrouping\tof\tsome\tof\tthe\tannotations\tthat\tcan\t \fe\tassociate\b\twith\tthe\ttext.\t\tThe\ttype\tof\tfile\tto\t\fe\tprocesse\b\t (local\t file,\t online\t \bocument,\t or\t generate\b\t text)\t can\t \fe\t selecte\b\t as\t well\t as\t a\t lexicon\t \fy\t choosing\t an\t appropriate\t \bomain.\t The\t \bomain\t selection\t controls\t \bictionary\t stacking\t within\tthe\tcalle\b\tMT\tengine.\tThe\tname\b\tentity\toption\tuses\t pattern\tmatching\tto\t\betect\thits\tfrom\ta\tpre-\besignate\b\tlist\tof\t unique\t names.\t These\t i\bentifie\b\t name\b\t entities,\t their\t location,\tan\b\tappropriate\ttranslations\tare\tannotate\b.\t\t The\tanalyst\tcan\tchoose\tfrom\tseveral\tMT\tengines\t(as\tshown\t at\tLocation\b 3).\t The\t selection\t of\t the\t MT\t engines\t is\t colorco\be\b\t to\t in\bicate\t their\t availa\fility.\t The\t color\t co\bing\t is\t change\b\tupon\tselection\tof\ta\tlanguage\tpair.\t\freen\tin\bicates\t that\tan\tMT\tengine\tsupports\tthe\tlanguage\tpair,\tred\tin\bicates\t that\t the\t MT\t engine\t cannot\t process\t the\t language\t pair,\t an\b\t blue\t\benotes\tthe\tcurrently\tselecte\b\tMT\tengine.\tA\tuser\tcan\t enter\tthe\tfile\tto\t\fe\ttranslate\b\t\birectly\tin\tthe\tFile:\ttext\tfiel\b\t or\t can\t \frowse\t the\t local\t \birectory\t structure\t to\t select\t a\t file\t for\tuploa\bing\tinto\tthe\ttext\tarea.\t Location\b 4\t is\t the\t text\t area\t that\t contains\t the\t results\t of\t the\t automate\b\t translations.\t Human\t translations\t are\t entere\b\t \birectly\tin\tthis\ttext\tarea\tto\tcreate\treference\ttranslations\tfor\t evaluation.\t The\t resulting\t reference\t translation\t is\tannotate\b\t with\tthe\ttranslator’s\tname\tan\b\texplicitly\tconnecte\b\twith\tthe\t source\t \bocument.\t Post-e\bits\t of\t MT\t output\t can\t also\t \fe\t \birectly\tentere\b\tinto\tthe\ttarget\tresults\tarea,\tan\b\tare\t\benote\b\t as\tsuch\twithin\tthe\tinternal\tsmart\t\bocument.\t The\t translation\t controls\t an\b\t configuration\t options\tare\t \bepicte\b\t at\tLocation\b 5.\t The\t options\t are\t also\t color-co\be\b\t an\b\t are\t MT-\bepen\bent.\t Upon\t selecting\t an\t MT\tengine,\tthe\t configuration\t options\t are\t color\t co\be\b\t appropriately\t to\t green\t,\t\flue,\tor\tre\b.\tThe\tuser\tof\tthe\tMTriage\ttool\tcan\ttoggle\t transliteration\t on\t the\t output\t \bata,\t as\t well\t as\t request\t normalization\tof\tthe\tsource\t\bata\t\fy\tselecting\tthese\toptions.\t An\talgorithm\twithin\tthe\ttool\tfor\tcalculating\tthe\tnum\fer\tof\t NFWs\t is\t use\b\t to\t \bisplay\t the\t metric\t \birectly\t on\t the\tuser\t interface\t after\t translation.\t The\t algorithm\t is\t MT-specific,\t \fase\b\t on\t the\t presence\t of\t \belimiters\t or\tother\tnotations\tthat\t \bistinguish\tthe\tNFWs\tfrom\tthe\trest\tof\tthe\ttext.\tTranslating\ta\t \bocument\t with\t the\t \befault\t settings\t is\t \bone\t \fy\t pressing\t the\t Translate\t \futton.\t Using\t the\tTranslateWithOptions\b\futton\t causes\t MTriage\t to\t parameterize\t the\t configuration\t options\t selecte\b\t\fy\tthe\tuser.\t Viewing\t the\t internal\t smart\t \bocument\t is\t \bone\t \fy\t rightclicking\ton\tthe\tuser\tinterface\tan\b\tchoosing\tthat\toption\tfrom\t a\t pop-up\t context\t menu.\t Exporting\t the\t internal\t smart\t \bocument\t to\t multiple\t parallel\t text\t files,\t \t creating\t a\t multilingual\t Excel\t sprea\bsheet,\t an\b\t saving\t the\t smart\t \bocument\t in\t XML\t format\t are\t functions\t that\t are\t also\t accessi\fle\ton\tthe\tcontext\tmenu.\t

sections.title: 3.2 Smart\tDocument\tSchema\t
paragraphs: The\t annotations\t ha\b\t to\t \fe\t associate\b\t with\t the\t source\t \bocument\tin\ta\tway\tthat\t\bi\b\tnot\tmo\bify\tthe\toriginal\tcontent.\t Incorporating\tmarkup\t\birectly\twithin\tthe\ttext\twoul\b\trequire\t a\b\bitional\t processing\t to\t strip\t out\t the\t \betails\t prior\t to\t translation.\t The\t smart\t \bocument\t approach\t treats\t the\t \bocument\t as\t an\t o\fject,\t encapsulating\t the\t raw\t input\ttext\t within\tmeta\bata\tan\b\tannotations\tthat\t\bescri\fe\tit.\tUnlike\tthe\t

Annotate\ttool,\twhich\tuses\tlinguistic\tinformation\tan\b\thi\b\ben\t Markov\tmo\bels\tfor\tsyntactic\tcorpus\tannotations\t(Brants\t&\t Plaehn,\t 2000),\t we\t require\b\t a\t static\t structure\t for\t capturing\t annotations\twithin\tthe\t\bocuments.\t\t \t \t Figure\t1\tSmart\tDocument\tSchema\t \t The\tchoice\tof\tan\tXML\tschema\tsupports\tthe\to\fject-oriente\b\t view\t of\t the\t \bocument,\t separating\t the\t semantically\t useful\t smart\t \bocument\t structure\t from\t the\t applications\t that\t take\t a\bvantage\t of\t the\t meta\bata.\t Annotea,\t a\t RDF\t stan\bar\b\t \bevelope\b\t \fy\t the\t worl\bwi\be\t we\f\t consortium\t (W3C),\t supports\t we\f\t \fase\b\t \bocument\t sharing\t an\b\t colla\foration\t through\t markup\t tags,\t \fookmarks,\t an\b\t annotations.\t (Kahan\t et\tal,\t2001)\t\tAn\tXML\tschema,\tcalle\b\tWan\baML,\thas\t\feen\t \bevelope\b\tto\tcapture\tsingle\tlanguage\t\bocument\tannotations\t for\t the\t purpose\t of\t forensic\t han\bwriting\t analysis.\t (Franke,\t Guyon,\t&\tSchomaker,\t2004)\t\tIn\ta\tsimilar\tfashion,\tour\tsmart\t \bocument\t schema\t takes\t a\bvantage\t of\t the\t extensi\fility\t an\b\t flexi\fility\tof\ta\tmarkup\tlanguage\tfor\tannotations.\tIt\t\biffers\tin\t that\twe\tare\tnot\tconstraining\tour\t\bocuments\twith\trespect\tto\t genre\t (we\f\t \bocuments),\t monolingual\t text,\t or\t specific\t application\t (han\bwriting\t analysis).\t The\t use\t of\t XML\t namespaces\t will\t allow\t us\t to\t leverage\t the\t capa\filities\t in\t these\t other\t languages,\t focusing\t our\t efforts\t on\t capturing\t annotations\tfor\tpre-processing\tactivities.\t Figure\t 1\t is\t a\t visual\t representation\t of\t the\t smart\t \bocument\t XML\tschema.\tThe\timportant\tthing\tto\tnote\ta\fout\tthe\t\besign\t of\t this\t knowle\bge\t structure\t is\t that\t it\t \bescri\fes\t a\tsmart\t \bocument\t as\t containing\t multiple\t \bocuments\t an\b\t the\t meta\bata\ta\fout\tthose\t\bocuments.\tThe\texpan\be\b\tarea\tof\tthe\t schema\t(highlighte\b\tin\tyellow)\tshows\tsome\tof\tthe\tattri\futes\t a\fout\ta\tsource\t\bocument\tthat\tcoul\b\t\fe\tattache\b,\tsuch\tas\tthe\t locations\t of\t zones\t an\b\t fiel\bs\t within\t the\t text,\t the\tgenre\t of\t the\t \bocument,\t layout\t features,\t the\t presence\t of\t mixe\b\t language\t texts,\t an\b\t so\t on.\t These\t attri\fute\t annotations\t can\t \fe\tassigne\b\tto\tthe\t\bocument\tcomputationally,\tthrough\tuser\t input,\tor\ta\tcom\fination\tof\t\foth.\tWe\tplan\tto\texamine\tthe\tuse\t of\t machine\t learning\t for\t \befining\t smart\t \bocuments\t within\t MTriage,\t potentially\t creating\t feature\t vectors\t to\t automate\t annotations\t for\t large\t \batasets.\t \t One\t of\t the\t primary\t a\bvantages\t of\t XML\t as\t knowle\bge\t format\t for\t smart\t \bocuments\tis\tthe\ta\fility\tto\tuse\tXSL\tfor\ttransformations\tof\t the\t \bocuments,\t supporting\t multiple\t MT\t applications\t in\bepen\bent\tof\tthe\toriginal\tsource\tof\tthe\tmaterial.\tFor\tnow,\t MTriage\t constructs\t the\t internal\t smart\t \bocuments,\t \fut\tuses\t em\fe\b\be\b\t functions\t to\t generate\t the\t parallel\t texts,\t sprea\bsheets,\t an\b\t network\t messages\t for\t the\t MT\t we\f\t services.\t

sections.title: 4. Building\tCorpora\twith\tMTriage\t
paragraphs: The\t MTriage\t tool\t is\t \feing\t use\b\t to\t \fuil\b\t the\t \batasets\t necessary\tto\tevaluate\tthe\tpre-MT\tapproach.\t\t\tIn\tFigure\t3\ton\t page\t 6,\t a\t smart\t\bocument\tcontaining\tAra\fic\tsource\ttext\tis\t encapsulate\b\twith\ttranslate\b\tEnglish\tresults\t\bocuments.\tThe\t meta\bata\tfor\tthis\tparticular\t\bocument\tcontains\ttokenization\t information\t that\t was\t generate\b\t \fy\t MTriage.\t Between\tthe\t <tokens>\t tags,\t there\t are\t or\bere\b\t pairs\t of\t num\fers\t representing\tthe\tlocation\tan\b\tstring\tlength\t(respectively)\tof\t all\t the\t tokens\t in\t the\t Ur\bu\t source\t text.\t Using\t the\t Unico\be\t representation\t of\t the\t tokens,\t it\t is\t possi\fle\t to\t separate\t the\t tokens\t into\t su\f-types.\t The\t<tokens>\t tag\t with\t the\t punctuation\t type\t attri\fute\t contains\t or\ber\t pairs\t where\t the\t first\t value\t is\t the\t \betecte\b\t punctuation\t character\t an\b\t the\t secon\b\t value\t is\t its\t position\t in\t the\t original\t source\t text.\t\t Using\t the\t same\t metho\b,\t MTriage\t can\t i\bentify\t num\fer\t tokens\t an\b\t potential\t NFWs\t as\t tokens\t that\t are\t using\tan\t alternate\t script\t that\t the\t primary\t text.\t The\t automate\b\tscript\t i\bentification\tof\t“Ara\fic”\tis\t\fase\b\ton\tthe\tUnico\be\trange.\t\t There\t is\t an\t automate\b\t translation\t from\tMTEngine5\t within\t the\t smart\t \bocument.\t The\t NFW\t count\t for\t this\t particular\t engine\tcan\t\fe\t\betermine\b,\tsince\tthe\t\fracket\t“[]”\t\belimiter\tis\t use\b\taroun\b\tthe\ttransliterate\b\ttext.\tThe\treference\t\bocument\t create\b\t \fy\t our\t translator\t is\t inclu\be\b\t as\t a\t groun\b\t truth\t English\tversion\tof\tthe\tAra\fic\ttext.\tThe\tvariant\tattri\fute\ton\t \foth\t non-source\t \bocuments\t i\bentify\t them\t as\t translations\t an\b\tinclu\be\tlanguage\tpair\tmapping\tinformation.\tAccor\bing\t to\t our\t translator,\t the\t capa\fility\t for\t visual\t inspections\t of\t parallel\tMT\toutputs\talone\thas\tenhance\b\tthe\t\bata\tgathering\t an\b\tanalysis\tprocess.\t A\tcase\tstu\by\twhere\tthe\tusefulness\tof\tMTriage\twas\trecently\t vali\bate\b\t was\t \buring\t ARL’s\t participation\t in\t the\t Ur\bu\t Language\t Track\t for\t the\t NIST\t Evaluation.\t We\t focuse\b\ton\t research\t issues\t of\t augmenting\t MT\t engines\t that\t support\t Ur\bu-to-English\t translation.\t (Voss\t et\t al,\t 2008)\t Ur\bu,\t as\t a\t Less\t Commonly\t Taught\t Language\t (LTCL),\t ha\b\t fewer\t resources\t availa\fle\t in\t terms\t of\t \foth\t MT\t engines\t an\b\t parallel\tcorpora\tfor\t\fuil\bing\tengines.\tBecause\tMT\tengines\t are\t fairly\t static\t with\t respect\t to\t lexicon,\t translators\t encounter\t increasing\t num\fers\t of\t NFWs\t when\t trying\t to\t process\t large\t \batasets.\t From\t an\t MT\t stakehol\ber\t

perspective,\t there\t is\t the\t question\t of\t how\t much\t \bata\t is\t necessary\t for\t improving\t their\t existing\t engines\t an\b\thow\t to\t effectively\t apply\t the\t \bata.\t To\t answer\t these\t questions,\t we\t con\bucte\b\t empirical\t stu\bies\t with\t the\t NIST\t evaluation\t \bataset.\t The\tMT\tengines\tthat\tsupport\tthe\tUr\bu-to-English\tlanguage\t pairs\twere\taccessi\fle\tthrough\tMTriage.\tThe\ttranslators\tan\b\t analysts\twere\ta\fle\tto\tuse\tthe\ttool\tfor\ttranslating\tportions\tof\t the\t NIST\t \batasets\t an\b\t specific\t \bata\t gathering\t tasks.\t One\t particular\tuse\tof\tMTriage\twas\tin\tharvesting\tNFWs\tto\tcreate\t lexicons\t for\t MT\t engines.\t Source\t language\t text\t was\t collecte\b\tfrom\tthe\tNIST\tUr\bu\tresources\tas\twell\tas\tthrough\t a\t We\f\t scraping\t application.\t The\t We\f\t scraper\t analyze\b\t Ur\bu\t news\t sites,\t extracting\t the\t Ur\bu\ttext\ton\ta\t\baily\t\fasis.\t Our\tUr\bu\ttranslator\tcoul\b\tthen\tuse\tMTriage\tto\ttranslate\tthe\t source\ttext\tagainst\tthe\tUr\bu\tMT\tengines\tto\ti\bentify\twor\bs\t an\b\t phrases\t that\t were\t not\t part\t of\t the\t engine’s\t current\t lexicon.\t Figure\t 4\t on\t page\t 7\t is\t an\t Excel\t sprea\bsheet\t generate\b\t\fy\tMTriage\tthat\tshows\tthe\tMT\toutput\tas\tparallel\t text.\tMTriage\tuse\b\tthe\tinternal\tsmart\t\bocument\tstructure\tto\t generate\t a\t sprea\bsheet\t with\t the\t original\t source\t language\t text\t an\b\t two\t translations\t using\tMTEngine5.\t MTriage\t use\b\t meta\bata\t a\fout\t the\tsource\t\bocument\tto\tset\tthe\tappropriate\t text\t \birection,\t in\t this\t instance,\t right-to-left.\t In\t the\t secon\b\t column\t on\t the\t sheet,\t the\t translation\t shows\t NFWs\t as\t transliterate\b\tLatin\tcharacters\twithin\t\frackets.\tTo\tgenerate\t the\t thir\b\t column,\t the\t translator\t turn\t off\t the\t transliteration\t option,\t leaving\t the\t Ur\bu\t string\t in\t the\t text.\t Giving\t the\t translator\tthe\ta\fility\tto\texamine\tthe\tnew\twor\b\tin\tits\toriginal\t context\thelps\twith\twor\b\tsense\t\bisam\figuation\tan\b\tsupports\t a\tmore\taccurate\treference\ttranslation\tfor\tthe\tnew\tlexicon.\t We\t constructe\b\t several\t lexicons\t using\t this\t technique\t for\t use\t in\t our\t augmentation\t experiments.\t For\t one\t of\t the\t MT\t engines,\t we\t converte\b\t the\t lexicons\t to\t customize\b\t user\t \bictionaries\t for\t stacking\t within\t the\t engine.\t We\t then\t ran\t a\t series\tof\texperiments\tof\tthe\tNIST\tevaluation\t\bataset,\tusing\t MTriage\t to\t parameterize\t the\t selection\t of\t user\t \bictionary.\t\t We\t evaluate\b\t the\t MT\t output\t using\t the\t assesse\b\t BLEU\t score\t against\t the\t \faseline\t (no\t custom\t Ur\bu\t \bictionary).\t\t There\twas\ta\tslight\tincrease\tof\tBLEU\tscore\tin\tone\tcase,\t\fut\t it\t was\t too\t small\t an\t increase\t to\t \fe\t statistically\t significant.\t The\t other\t scores\t remaine\b\t a\fout\t the\tsame\tas\tthe\t\faseline,\t or\t \becrease\b\t \fy\t a\t small\t amount.\t The\t lack\t of\t major\t improvement\t coul\b\t \fe\t \bue\t to\t the\t sample\t size\t or\t a\t lack\t of\t sensitivity\t to\t this\t type\t of\t augmentation\t within\t the\t BLEU\t automate\b\tmetric.\t\tThe\tNFW\tcount\tfor\tthe\tevaluation\t\bata\t \bi\b\t improve,\t however,\t with\t up\t to\t ten\t percent\t of\t the\t new\t wor\bs\t \feing\t \betecte\b\t \fy\t the\t MT\t engine.\t It\t woul\b\t \fe\t interesting\tto\tsee\tif\tthere\tis\ta\tcorrespon\bing\tincrease\tin\tthe\t measure\tof\teffectiveness\tof\tthe\tMT\toutput,\ti.e.\tthe\tusa\fility\t of\tthe\tMT\toutput\tfor\tspecific\ttasks.\t

sections.title: 5. Future\tWork\t
paragraphs: The\t potential\t improvement\t on\t MT\t quality\t through\t annotation-\briven\t pre-processing\t activities\t seems\t intuitive\t an\b\t supporte\b\t anec\botally\t \fy\t our\t efforts\t so\t far.\t We\t are\t using\t the\t MTriage\t tool\t an\b\t smart\t \bocument\t schema\t in\t an\t empirical\t stu\by\t with\t automate\b\t metrics\t to\t vali\bate\tthis\t improvement\t statistically.\t The\t smart\t \bocument\t format\t is\t \feing\t leverage\b\t to\t support\t other\t MT\t \bata\t requirements,\t such\t as\t \fuil\bing\t parallel\t corpora\t for\t training\t \batasets,\t segmentation\t an\b\t alignment\t of\t source\t \bocuments,\t an\b\t comparison\t of\t multiple\t human\t translations\t to\t calculate\t inter-annotator\t agreement.\t Incorporating\t a\baptive\t machine\t learning\t techniques,\t as\t \bescri\fe\b\t in\t the\t GATE\t (General\t Architecture\t for\t Text\t Engineering)\t (Cunningham\t et\t al,\t 2002)\t environment,\t into\t MTriage\t is\t \feing\t examine\b\t for\t automate\b\t annotation\t an\b\t information\t extraction\t on\tlarge\t \bata\tcollections.\t
